title: High-risk AI systems referred to in Article 6(2)
critical_importance: Defines all high-risk AI use cases triggering Chapter III requirements

use_cases.text: Remote biometric identification systems
use_cases.exclusion: This shall NOT include AI systems intended to be used for biometric verification the sole purpose of which is to confirm that a specific natural person is the person he or she claims to be
use_cases.note: Remote biometric IDENTIFICATION (one-to-many) is high-risk, but VERIFICATION (one-to-one authentication) is excluded

use_cases.text: AI systems intended to be used for biometric categorisation, according to sensitive or protected attributes or characteristics based on the inference of those attributes or characteristics
use_cases.sensitive_attributes: Race, political opinions, trade union membership, religion, philosophical beliefs, sex life, sexual orientation per Article 5(1)(g)

use_cases.text: AI systems intended to be used for emotion recognition
use_cases.note: Overlaps with Article 5(1)(f) prohibition in workplace/education contexts

use_cases.text: AI systems intended to be used as safety components in the management and operation of critical digital infrastructure, road traffic, or in the supply of water, gas, heating or electricity
use_cases.requirement: Must be used as safety component

use_cases.text: AI systems intended to be used to determine access or admission or to assign natural persons to educational and vocational training institutions at all levels

AI systems intended to be used to evaluate learning outcomes, including when those outcomes are used to steer the learning process of natural persons in educational and vocational training institutions at all levels
use_cases.scope: Learning outcome evaluation, especially when steering learning process
use_cases.examples: Automated grading systems, adaptive learning systems

use_cases.text: AI systems intended to be used for the purpose of assessing the appropriate level of education that an individual will receive or will be able to access, in the context of or within educational and vocational training institutions at all levels
AI systems intended to be used for monitoring and detecting prohibited behaviour of students during tests in the context of or within educational and vocational training institutions at all levels

area_4_employment.title: 4. Employment, workers management and access to self-employment

use_cases.text: AI systems intended to be used for the recruitment or selection of natural persons, in particular to place targeted job advertisements, to analyse and filter job applications, and to evaluate candidates
use_cases.examples: Automated recruiting tools, CV filtering systems

use_cases.text: AI systems intended to be used to make decisions affecting terms of work-related relationships, the promotion or termination of work-related contractual relationships, to allocate tasks based on individual behaviour or personal traits or characteristics or to monitor and evaluate the performance and behaviour of persons in such relationships
use_cases.examples: AI performance evaluation systems, algorithmic management, automated termination decisions

area_5_essential_services.title: 5. Access to and enjoyment of essential private services and essential public services and benefits

use_cases.text: AI systems intended to be used by public authorities or on behalf of public authorities to evaluate the eligibility of natural persons for essential public assistance benefits and services, including healthcare services, as well as to grant, reduce, revoke, or reclaim such benefits and services
use_cases.actor: Public authorities or on their behalf
use_cases.examples: Social welfare eligibility AI, healthcare access determination

use_cases.text: AI systems intended to be used to evaluate the creditworthiness of natural persons or establish their credit score, with the exception of AI systems used for the purpose of detecting financial fraud
use_cases.examples: Credit scoring algorithms, loan approval AI

use_cases.text: AI systems intended to be used for risk assessment and pricing in relation to natural persons in the case of life and health insurance

AI systems intended to evaluate and classify emergency calls by natural persons or to be used to dispatch, or to establish priority in the dispatching of, emergency first response services, including by police, firefighters and medical aid, as well as of emergency healthcare patient triage systems
use_cases.examples: 911 call classification AI, emergency room triage systems

area_6_law_enforcement.title: 6. Law enforcement
area_6_law_enforcement.note: All use cases require use by/on behalf of law enforcement authorities or EU institutions supporting law enforcement

use_cases.text: AI systems intended to be used by or on behalf of law enforcement authorities, or by Union institutions, bodies, offices or agencies in support of law enforcement authorities or on their behalf to assess the risk of a natural person becoming the victim of criminal offences

AI systems intended to be used by or on behalf of law enforcement authorities or by Union institutions, bodies, offices or agencies in support of law enforcement authorities as polygraphs or similar tools

AI systems intended to be used by or on behalf of law enforcement authorities, or by Union institutions, bodies, offices or agencies, in support of law enforcement authorities to evaluate the reliability of evidence in the course of the investigation or prosecution of criminal offences
use_cases.examples: Forensic analysis AI, evidence evaluation tools

use_cases.text: AI systems intended to be used by law enforcement authorities or on their behalf or by Union institutions, bodies, offices or agencies in support of law enforcement authorities for assessing the risk of a natural person offending or re-offending not solely on the basis of the profiling of natural persons as referred to in Article 3(4) of Directive (EU) 2016/680, or to assess personality traits and characteristics or past criminal behaviour of natural persons or groups
use_cases.scope: Recidivism risk assessment, personality assessment, criminal behavior analysis
use_cases.condition: NOT solely based on profiling per Law Enforcement Directive
use_cases.note: Compare to Article 5(1)(d) prohibition - this is permitted if not SOLELY profiling
use_cases.examples: Recidivism prediction tools (if combined with other factors)

use_cases.text: AI systems intended to be used by or on behalf of law enforcement authorities or by Union institutions, bodies, offices or agencies in support of law enforcement authorities for the profiling of natural persons as referred to in Article 3(4) of Directive (EU) 2016/680 in the course of the detection, investigation or prosecution of criminal offences
use_cases.scope: Law enforcement profiling during criminal proceedings
use_cases.note: Article 6(3) profiling carve-out applies - always high-risk, no opt-out

area_7_migration_asylum_border.title: 7. Migration, asylum and border control management
area_7_migration_asylum_border.note: All use cases require use by/on behalf of competent public authorities or EU institutions

use_cases.text: AI systems intended to be used by or on behalf of competent public authorities or by Union institutions, bodies, offices or agencies as polygraphs or similar tools

AI systems intended to be used by or on behalf of competent public authorities or by Union institutions, bodies, offices or agencies to assess a risk, including a security risk, a risk of irregular migration, or a health risk, posed by a natural person who intends to enter or who has entered into the territory of a Member State

AI systems intended to be used by or on behalf of competent public authorities or by Union institutions, bodies, offices or agencies to assist competent public authorities for the examination of applications for asylum, visa or residence permits and for associated complaints with regard to the eligibility of the natural persons applying for a status, including related assessments of the reliability of evidence

AI systems intended to be used by or on behalf of competent public authorities, or by Union institutions, bodies, offices or agencies, in the context of migration, asylum or border control management, for the purpose of detecting, recognising or identifying natural persons, with the exception of the verification of travel documents
use_cases.scope: Detection, recognition, identification in border context
use_cases.examples: Border facial recognition systems (except passport verification)

area_8_justice_democracy.title: 8. Administration of justice and democratic processes

use_cases.text: AI systems intended to be used by a judicial authority or on their behalf to assist a judicial authority in researching and interpreting facts and the law and in applying the law to a concrete set of facts, or to be used in a similar way in alternative dispute resolution
use_cases.actor: Judicial authority or on their behalf
use_cases.examples: AI legal research tools for judges, case outcome prediction for courts

use_cases.text: AI systems intended to be used for influencing the outcome of an election or referendum or the voting behaviour of natural persons in the exercise of their vote in elections or referenda. This does not include AI systems to the output of which natural persons are not directly exposed, such as tools used to organise, optimise or structure political campaigns from an administrative or logistical point of view
use_cases.scope: Influencing election outcomes or voting behavior
use_cases.exclusion: Backend campaign management tools where voters not directly exposed to AI output
use_cases.examples: Micro-targeted political persuasion AI (high-risk), Campaign logistics optimization (excluded)
use_cases.critical_distinction: Direct voter exposure vs. administrative/logistical backend tools

recurring_themes: High-stakes personal consequences (employment, benefits, criminal justice)
Vulnerable contexts (asylum seekers, criminal suspects, students)

article_6_3_interaction.opt_out_available: Yes, for all Annex III use cases if Article 6(3) conditions met
article_6_3_interaction.exception_profiling: If system performs profiling → always high-risk, no opt-out per Article 6(3) second subparagraph
article_6_3_interaction.burden_on_provider: Must document assessment and register per Article 49(2)

article_7_dynamic_amendments.commission_can_add: New use cases in existing areas if risk equivalent/greater per Article 7(1)-(2)
article_7_dynamic_amendments.commission_can_remove: Use cases if no longer pose significant risk per Article 7(3)
article_7_dynamic_amendments.note: Annex III is dynamic, not static

metadata.critical_dependency_for: All high-risk classification determinations per Article 6(2)
